name: Red Thai Curry Vegetables
description: This Vegan Thai Red Curry has the most flavorful, creamy sauce and is totally customizable depending on what vegetables you have on hand. Ready in about 30 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 1  red bell pepper, thinly sliced into 2 inch slices
1  yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced into 2 inch slices
2  medium carrots, peeled and cut into matchsticks or small rounds
2 cups thinly sliced kale OR spinach
1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce (tamari for gluten free)
4 cups cooked white or brown rice
Optional: Sriracha hot sauce, fresh chopped basil or cilantro

recipeInstructions.text: First, prepare all of the vegetables and have them close by before you heat the pan. To make the recipe easier, purchase pre-chopped vegetables or frozen. Cook your rice according to package instructions.
recipeInstructions.name: First, prepare all of the vegetables and have them close by before you heat the pan. To make the recipe easier, purchase pre-chopped vegetables or frozen. Cook your rice according to package instructions.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1-2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Once it's warm, add the chopped onion and cook, stirring often, until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1-2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Once it's warm, add the chopped onion and cook, stirring often, until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the bell peppers, carrots, broccoli and cauliflower. Continue to cook, stirring frequently, for about 2-3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the bell peppers, carrots, broccoli and cauliflower. Continue to cook, stirring frequently, for about 2-3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: To the pan, add the red curry paste, coconut milk, and water. Stir well for a few minutes, until the curry paste is dissolved in the coconut milk/water. Now add the kale or spinach and stir it in. Bring to a simmer, then lower the heat and cook covered for 5-10 minutes, until the vegetables have softened.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the chopped tomatoes, pure maple syrup, soy sauce and fresh lime juice. Remove from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with cooked rice and optional Sriracha and fresh basil/cilantro if desired. Enjoy!
